title: Sound-Horizon-Agnostic Inference of the Hubble Constant and Neutrino Mass from BAO, CMB Lensing, and Galaxy Weak Lensing and Clustering
summary: This paper presents a sound-horizon-agnostic determination of the Hubble constant by combining DESI DR2 baryon acoustic oscillation (BAO) data with CMB lensing measurements, galaxy weak lensing and clustering correlations, and the Pantheon+ supernova sample. The analysis treats the sound horizon at the drag epoch as a free parameter.
usefulness_reason: The abstract mentions combining "BAO data with the latest cosmic microwave background (CMB) lensing measurements from Planck, ACT, and SPT-3G, the angular size of the CMB acoustic scale, Dark Energy Survey Year-3 (3x2-pt) galaxy weak lensing and clustering correlations, and the Pantheon+ supernova sample." This clearly indicates the use of "Survey data" and a "Contextual dataset" (multiple datasets combined for a specific context).
